page.title: 03St.MARY the VIRGIN, BENTLEY
page.content: Sited on the high ground with views to the East, with exterior of brick, flint and stone, but little remains of the{12C}foundation built in malm stone quarried locally at{Perrylands.}The font basin, zig-zag decorated piscina and the scallop capitalled piers on the N. choir wall remain. The capitals carry traces of red scroll painting and roses. In the N. chapel is a{13C.} piscina with dog-tooth carving and the medieval timber roof. In the S.chapel dedicated to St Martin a damaged{14C.} piscina with trefoil head. Also on S. wall a carved marble monument to {Margarita Windsor 1631.}Restoration in 1400 is commemorated by 3 consecration crosses carved on the 3 choir piers and small,crude pilgrim's crosses link it to the{Pilgrim's Way.}Restoration in{1890}by{Henry Woodyer.}Reading room added in 1984 to the N.side.
